titles.title: A joint resolution to encourage increased international cooperation to protect biological diversity.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Called up by House Under Suspension of Rules.

vote.text: Passed House (Amended) by Yea-Nay Vote: 398 - 0 (Record Vote No: 334).

action.text: Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

calendar.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Reported to Senate by Senator Pell without amendment and with a preamble. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 1005.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 9/22/1988--Passed House amended. (Measure passed House, amended, roll call #334 (398-0)) Calls upon the President to continue exerting U.S. leadership to achieve negotiation of an international convention to preserve biological diversity. Directs the President to report to the Congress on the progress toward such negotiation.
